4080.info: This event occurs when the player hovers the mouse over an interactive object. It contains information about the object under the mouse, and the duration of the hover. This event can be used to diagnose things like planning (are they hovering the mouse over tiles for long periods before they use those tiles), and determine which objects the player thinks are important.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: how long the mouse cursor dwells over the object when the player dwells for longer than 1sec
args.name: dwell_time

args.info: the object or piece of art the mouse was hovering over
args.name: object

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

5010.info: This event occurs when a hazard is removed from the garden. It contains information about the type of hazard, the hazard's location in the garden, and the duration the hazard was present in the garden.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the area of the garden the hazard is locatedsomething like "plot1", "plot2", or "hedgerow1"
args.name: location

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: the type of hazard that is being removed
args.name: hazard_type

args.info: the time the hazard was present in the garden in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

5030.info: This event occurs when the pause menu is closed.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: the duration spent paused in milliseconds.
args.name: pause_duration

4070.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on something that isnt covered elsewhere. It can be useful in determining if there are attractive distractions (things the player think should do something, but dont) in the game, or diagnosing players who are having mechanical difficulties (near misses).

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: the object or piece of art that was clicked
args.name: object

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

4022.info: This event occurs when the player clicks one of the tools to select it. It contains information about the tool selected and the location of the click.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: name of the tool selected
args.name: tool

args.info: name of the previously selected tool
args.name: previous_tool

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

4020.info: This event occurs when the player clicks one of the presented information sources. It contains information about the object selected, the correctness of the action, and the coordinates of the click.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: name of the object selected
args.name: object

args.info: was this the correct object to select?
args.name: correct

4021.info: This event occurs when the player uses one of the tools on the garden. It contains information about the tool used, the target area of the farm, and the coordinates of the click.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: name of the tool used
args.name: tool

args.info: the area of the garden the tool is being applied tosomething like "plot1", "plot2", or "hedgerow1"
args.name: location

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses after the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

args.info: did using this tool have an effect on the garden or was there no effect (for example due to clover already planted or ladybugs alread present)?
args.name: effective

3110.info: The end of system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game finishes delivering instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction including duration. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions and the amount of time they consume. We can answer questions like, how much time elapsed while the game was presenting instruction?

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the type of media that has just played:'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: did the feedback finish playing or was it interrupted?
args.name: finished

3120.info: The end of system-initiated feedback (Incorrect) event occurs when the game finishes delivering feedback to the player in response to an incorrect round attempt (pressing the go button with the incorrect answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, how much time elapsed while the game was presenting feedback?

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the type of media that has just played:'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: did the feedback finish playing or was it interrupted?
args.name: finished

3121.info: The end of system-initiated feedback (Correct) event occurs when the game finishes delivering feedback to the player in response to a correct round attempt (pressing the go button with the correct answer). It contains information that describes the duration and content of the instruction, and will likely occur in conjunction with a beat round event. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, how much time elapsed while the game was presenting feedback?

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the type of media that has just played:'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: did the feedback finish playing or was it interrupted?
args.name: finished

3021.info: The system-initiated feedback (Correct) event occurs when the game starts delivering feedback to the player in response to a correct round attempt (pressing the go button with the correct answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction, and will likely occur in conjunction with a beat round event. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, did players who received feedback X do better than those who did not?

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the type of media that has just played:'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

3020.info: The system-initiated feedback (Incorrect) event occurs when the game starts delivering feedback to the player in response to an incorrect round attempt (pressing the go button with the incorrect answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, did players who received feedback X do better than those who did not?

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the type of media that has just played:'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

2037.info: The beat gardening segment event is triggered when the player finishes a gardening segment after finishing growing the crops. This event provides information about when the player is engaging in different sections of gameplay.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: number of the current round when that just completed
args.name: round

args.info: number of times a crop was harmed during the round
args.name: misses

args.info: the duration of the segment in milliseconds. Time between start segment and beat segment.
args.name: duration

args.info: the total duration spent paused during the segment in milliseconds.
args.name: pause_duration

args.info: the type of vegetable grown in this round
args.name: vegetable

args.info: the weight of the vegetable at the end of the segment
args.name: weight

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

2035.info: The beat information segment event is triggered when the player finishes the information selecting segment by selecting the correct source. This event provides information about when the player is engaging in different sections of gameplay.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: number of the current round when that just completed
args.name: round

args.info: number of times an incorrect information source was selected
args.name: misses

args.info: the duration of the segment in milliseconds. Time between start segment and beat segment.
args.name: duration

args.info: the total duration spent paused during the segment in milliseconds.
args.name: pause_duration

args.info: the type of vegetable grown in this round
args.name: vegetable

2031.info: The exit round event is triggered when the player exits a round by navigating out of the round via the pause menu. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: number of the current round when that just completed
args.name: round

args.info: number of times a crop was harmed during the round
args.name: misses

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: duration

args.info: the total duration spent paused during the round in milliseconds.
args.name: pause_duration

args.info: the type of vegetable grown in this round
args.name: vegetable

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

2030.info: The beat round event is triggered when the player finishes a round by growing the vegetable. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: number of the current round when that just completed
args.name: round

args.info: number of times a crop was harmed during the round and the number of times an incorrect information source was selected
args.name: misses

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: duration

args.info: the total duration spent paused during the round in milliseconds.
args.name: pause_duration

args.info: the type of vegetable grown in this round
args.name: vegetable

args.info: the weight of the vegetable at the end of the round
args.name: weight

args.info: the current status of the garden plots, hazards, and defenses when the event occurs{"plot1":{"vegetable_size": int, "moisture": int, "rabbit": bool, "insect": bool}, "hedgerow1": {"clover": bool, "ladybugs": bool, "rabbit_progress": number, "insect_progress": number}, ...}
args.name: garden_status

2010.info: The end game event occurs when the player exits the game. This is used to compute things like time spent in game.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: session_duration

args.info: home', 'navigation', 'exit' - if the user left the game via clicking the home button, navigating to a new page, or closing the application/browser
args.name: exit_type

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

5000.info: This event occurs when a hazard to the garden appears (including dry soil). It contains information about the state of the garden, the type of hazard, and the location of the hazard.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the area of the garden the hazard is appearingsomething like "plot1", "plot2", or "hedgerow1"
args.name: location

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: the type of hazard that appeared
args.name: hazard_type

args.name: location

args.name: round

args.info: the type of hazard that is harming the plant
args.name: hazard_type

3010.info: The system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game delivers instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. This event differs from events 3020 and 3021 as it captures instructions that are not given in response to player action. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions. We can answer questions like, did players who received instruction X do better than those who did not?

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the type of media that has just played:'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

4010.info: This event occurs when the player clicks past the starting landing page.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

4016.info: This event occurs when the player clicks next to advance a screen. It contains information about the screens being transitioned from and to.

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

args.info: name of the screen being transitioned away from
args.name: previous_screen

args.info: name of the screen being transitioned to
args.name: next_screen

2025.info: The start information segment event is triggered at the start the segment of gameplay where the player is required to select an information source. This event provides information about when the player is engaging in different sections of gameplay.

args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter

2000.info: The start game event is triggered at the very beginning of the game (after the game finishes loading). This is used to compute things like time spent in game.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: version identifier for the current build of the game
args.name: version

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round

2027.info: The start gardening segment event is triggered at the start of the section of gameplay where the player must tend to the garden. This event provides information about when the player is engaging in different sections of gameplay.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: number of the round that just started
args.name: round

args.info: the type of vegetable grown in this round
args.name: vegetable

2020.info: The start round event is triggered at the start of a round after the player selects the level to play. This event provides information about the game characteristics of the round (i.e. resources, objectives, setup). It is used in calculating things like time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has visited (exposures).

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: number of the round that just started
args.name: round

args.info: the type of vegetable grown in this round
args.name: vegetable

4011.info: This event occurs when the player clicks one of the levels/vegetables to play. It contains information about the selected vegetable and the location of the click.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: session event counter
args.name: event_count

args.info: the game screen coordinates of the clickdictionary:{x: int, y: int, stage_width: int, stage_height: int}
args.name: coordinates

args.info: the name of the vegetable associated with the level
args.name: vegetable

args.info: number of the current round when the event takes place or 0 if no round
args.name: round
